citation: _King James Bible_ (2017) King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published: 1769)
raw_response:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
_King James Bible_ (2017) King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published: 1769)

SOURCE TYPE: web page / classical work (Bible)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Punctuation / ordering: Parenthetical year placement and following punctuation are incorrect.
   What’s wrong: The citation shows the year in parentheses immediately after the italicized title but lacks the required period after the parenthetical year and the ordering/spacing is nonstandard for APA references.
   Should be: _King James Bible_. (2017). King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/

❌ Original-publication note formatting and placement:
   What’s wrong: "(Original work published: 1769)" is appended with a colon and placed after the URL. APA prefers the original publication year to be placed immediately after the reference date using a slash (for republished/classic works) or, if included as a note, formatted without a colon and not after the URL.
   Should be either:
   - If indicating original and reprint years: _King James Bible_. (1769/2017). King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/
   OR
   - If keeping the 2017 date as the version followed by an original-work note: _King James Bible_. (2017). King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published 1769).

❌ Italics and capitalization guidance (clarification, not strictly an error if left as-is):
   What’s wrong: Title is italicized, which is correct, but APA recommends including the edition/version when relevant (e.g., King James Version). The reference should use the version name as part of the title if that is the specific edition used.
   Should be (if specifying version): _The King James Bible_. (2017). King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Suggested corrected examples (choose one format appropriate to your usage):

1) Using republished/original year slash:
_King James Bible_. (1769/2017). King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/

2) Using 2017 as the version date with original-work note:
_King James Bible_. (2017). King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/ (Original work published 1769)

3) Including edition/version name (recommended for clarity):
_The King James Bible_. (1769/2017). King James Bible Online. https://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/

Note: The Bible is a classical religious work; APA often advises citing it in-text only and not in the reference list. If you include it in the reference list, use one of the corrected formats above.

citation: Malory, T. (2017). _Le morte d'Arthur_ (P. J. C. Field, Ed.). D. S. Brewer.
raw_response:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Malory, T. (2017). _Le morte d'Arthur_ (P. J. C. Field, Ed.). D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

✓ No APA 7 formatting errors detected

Notes:
- The author, year, book title (italicized), editor parenthetical, and publisher are present and ordered correctly for an edited book in APA 7th edition.
- APA 7 no longer requires a location for the publisher, so omission of a place is correct.

citation: Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). 2019. _A New Companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.
raw_response:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). 2019. _A New Companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.

SOURCE TYPE: book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Year (publication date): Incorrect punctuation/placement
   What’s wrong: The year appears as "2019." after the editors' parenthetical without being enclosed in parentheses.
   Should be: Enclose the year in parentheses and place it immediately after the editor parenthetical. Example: (Eds.). (2019).

❌ Title capitalization: Not in APA sentence case
   What’s wrong: The title is in title case ("A New Companion to Malory"). APA 7 uses sentence case for book titles (capitalize only the first word of the title/subtitle and proper nouns).
   Should be: _A new companion to Malory_ (italics retained; "Malory" stays capitalized as a proper noun).

Combined corrected citation (format example):
Leitch, M. G., & Rushton, C. J. (Eds.). (2019). _A new companion to Malory_. D. S. Brewer.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

citation: I. O. for Standardization. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html
raw_response:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
I. O. for Standardization. (2018). _Occupational health and safety management systems—Requirements with guidance for use_ (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html

SOURCE TYPE: other (technical standard / organization web publication)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Author: Incorrect organization name/format
   What’s wrong: "I. O. for Standardization." is not the correct name of the organization and uses an initialism/abbreviated, nonstandard form.
   Should be: Use the full organization name as author. For this standard: "International Organization for Standardization." (Or simply "ISO" if you choose the acronym — then be consistent: ISO.)

❌ Punctuation before URL: Period immediately before URL
   What’s wrong: There is a period after the closing parenthesis and before the URL: "... (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018). https://..."
   Should be: Do not place punctuation immediately before a URL. Remove the period so there is a space directly before the URL: "... (ISO Standard No. 45001:2018) https://www.iso.org/standard/63787.html"

Notes (not flagged as errors because current citation is acceptable if corrected above):
- Date format (2018), title in italics, and the standard number are correctly presented.
- Because the author (International Organization for Standardization) is the same as the publisher, omitting a separate publisher name is appropriate in APA 7.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

citation: O’Connor, J., & Smith, L. (2017). _Nancy Clancy, late-breaking news!_ (R. Preiss Glasser, Illus.). HarperCollins Publishers.
raw_response:
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
O’Connor, J., & Smith, L. (2017). _Nancy Clancy, late-breaking news!_ (R. Preiss Glasser, Illus.). HarperCollins Publishers.

SOURCE TYPE: book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Publisher: Publisher name format
   What’s wrong: APA 7 prefers the publisher name without business words such as "Publishers," "Company," or "Inc." The entry "HarperCollins Publishers" includes the extra word "Publishers."
   Should be: HarperCollins

Notes (no required changes):
- Authors, year, italicized title, and illustrator parenthetical are correctly placed and formatted. The illustrator is properly shown in parentheses after the title (initials + surname, role).
- Title appears in sentence case and is correctly italicized using the provided underscore markup.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
